questions.question: Which of the following is used to uniquely identify a record in a table?
Which SQL clause is used to filter the result set based on a condition?
What does the ACID property in DBMS stand for?
Which of the following is a type of JOIN in SQL?
Which command is used to remove all rows from a table without logging individual row deletions?
Which normal form eliminates transitive dependency?
What is the role of an index in a database?
options: It increases the size of the database

questions.question: Which key is used to link two tables together?
Which operation is used to combine data from two or more tables based on a related column?
What does the term 'schema' refer to in DBMS?
options: The structure that defines the organization of data
questions.answer: The structure that defines the organization of data

questions.question: Which SQL statement is used to extract data from a database?
Which of the following ensures the referential integrity of data in one table to match values in another?
Which of the following is a DDL command?
Which command is used to change the structure of an existing table?
Which type of key can have NULL values and still be used to identify records uniquely?
